data.title: Add faction tooltips to TD and D2K.
data.body:
A little widget, when the faction is selected, or at least while the cursor is hovering over the name when choosing, that describes the faction.

example: a blurb like below would appear in a small window when deciding on the GDI team...

The GDI (Global Defense Initiative) is the international pact that aims to bring down the Brotherhood of Nod. They have technological prowess on their side.

An optional blurb, maybe with \n separation in the same text block:

Advantages: +3 attack, +2 move
Disadvantages: Higher cost

data.title: Implemented Saving and Loading

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
This is the combined results of my discussion with pchote, #6280 and #6238.

This supports loading in multiplayer and singleplayer, you can take over another human player when you load.
You can watch replays in this branch as normal, both loaded and original.

Only the host needs to have the replays for them to load,
not sure how Dedicated servers would work with this.

 ^ Needs testing on multiple computers.

Problems that might or might not be addressed:
- UI is needed, 3f6c17e is a prototype (pchote doesnt like this so looking for a better way)
            http://imgur.com/a/QgqmE#0
- Doesnt support taking over AI (this would need a rewrite on how the AI gets orders)
- Start button is broken when loading, to load everyone has to hit ready.
- If the save was made after a player disconnected it will freeze when trying to load.
- When you save a game where the admin is a spectator and load, if the admin is a spectator (in the loading lobby) it kicks the admin and freezes the game.
- If you join a lobby where a save game was loaded it doesnt force your faction/team/spawnpoint on join, have to switch slots to load the settings

This PR also makes observers independant of the game, this means they no longer lag the game for other players, but they can still chat even if they somehow fall behind (because of lag).

You can have as many observers as you want when loading/playing a game, they dont affect the game (unless one of the spectators is the admin, he is the only one who works like the old observers since he needs to give orders to bots).

data.title: Include MetaData:Author: somewhere in the main menu?
data.body:
Should we nclude MetaData:Author: or some other kind of "tag" somewhere in the main menu's labels?

Over or under the version number, maybe to the side, or the bottom or corners of the screen, etc.

examples of what the text could say:

MyMod (c) 2010 by Creator

by CreationTeam

Metadata should of course keep the specific details separate. In other words, the Author is not "2010 Creator", but you can include a Year: trait to that effect.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3936892-include-metadata-author-somewhere-in-the-main-menu?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: ^Vehicle inheritance bloat
data.body:
As requested this is being filed as a bug.

There is a ^Vehicle class, but none of the other "vehicles" seem to inherit its traits, like ^Tank or ^Plane.

data.title: More Lua API enhancements
data.body:
includes touchups to gdi01.

I'm not sure if I got all the places where I am supposed to use `.Dispose()` right. That is definitely something you should look out for during review.

[gdi02](https://github.com/obrakmann/OpenRA/compare/gdi02), [gdi04c](https://github.com/obrakmann/OpenRA/compare/gdi04c), [nod01](https://github.com/obrakmann/OpenRA/compare/nod01), [nod03a](https://github.com/obrakmann/OpenRA/compare/nod03a) and [nod03b](https://github.com/obrakmann/OpenRA/compare/nod03b) are done as well. I'll open PRs for them once this has been merged.

data.title: Adds WithBarrel trait
data.body:
Closes #6249.

Works like WithVoxelBarrel, just for SHPs (and other image formats that might be supported in the future).

data.title: Added name before powertimer
data.body:
Would fix #4798

Although this solution seems ugly imho (sorry, I didn't know how to do that else), it works.

data.title: Added tab completion to in-game and lobby chat.
data.body:
- Both player names and chat commands can be completed.
- ~~Names of local players and bots are not candidates for completion.~~
- If a completed name is the first word ": " is appended to the end.
- The hotkey for toggling team/all chat has been moved to left Alt.

data.title: Change replay to serverside
data.body:
This moves the replay playing code serverside, also allows loading from replay.

TODO:
- Support Multiplayer loading
- Change Replay browser to use the server system
- Allow to change players between saves.
- ~~Move the load button in the lobby so it doesnt cover the options button.~~

This superseeds #6238 completly except you currently cant watch replays of loaded games,
this will be fixed as soon as I move the replay watching to the new system.

data.title: Fix for blinking vivid red color on unread news
data.body: This is a rebase and fix of pull request #6016.

data.title: Sometimes there is invisible ore
data.body:
I think its because the amount of ore in that square is so little that it doesnt have its own graphic set?

Nevertheless, it is ore, and i cant build on those spots.

data.title: SpriteRenderer.DrawSprite offset bug
data.body:
Doesn't correctly offset the sprite in relation to size parameter. Discovered trying to get the cursor to offset correctly. Not experienced enough with the engine to decide how to go about solving this, so new issue is go.

OpenRA.Game/Graphics/SpriteRenderer.cs Line 76

`Util.FastCreateQuad(vertices, location + s.offset, s, paletteIndex, nv, size);`

Should behave like

`Util.FastCreateQuad(vertices, location + s.offset * size/s.size, s, paletteIndex, nv, size);`

data.title: Unit and Turret ROT should be brought in line with Speed
data.body:
1) Abbreviations don't follow OpenRA's style conventions, so ROT should be renamed to something like RateOfTurn/TurnRate/TurnSpeed, or something along those lines.

2) In comparison to Speed, which uses world units, ROT is too coarse-grained and should use  comparable values for consistency and more fine-grained control (for example: what is now a turn rate of 3, should be 128 for RA/TD).
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3787860-unit-and-turret-rot-should-be-brought-in-line-with-speed?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Remove actors without counting deaths and kills
data.body:
Would fix #6223.

But this fix will prevent husks and deathbuildingstates etc. from being shown.

data.title: Make a special kind of unit inheritance that allows for in-depth character play.
data.body:
Make a special kind of unit inheritance that allows for in-depth character play.

For example, a unit that can display a separate HUD so you can select what weapon it fires or equipment it has.

Kind of like making an adventure game out of RTS structure. Think "Commandos".

data.title: Units slow down depending on damage taken.
data.body:
Having a setting on/off, where units slow down movement when damaged. For example, a tank is too shot up to move fast enough, or a soldier is limping after being attacked.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3784038-units-slow-down-depending-on-damage-taken?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Avoid sending the map change order when selecting the same map.
data.body:
Fixes #6206.

Switching the map causes the client state to be changed to `Invalid`.  `UpdateCurrentMap` would normally verify that the map exists and then change the client state back to `NotReady`, but this check is skipped when switching to the same map.  If the game is then started with the force-start button, the server will notice that all of the players have an `Invalid` state and kick them as if they did not have the map.

Preventing the initial map order from being issued avoids this.

data.title: Ore and Gems are rendered under craters
data.body: If you bombard some ore or gems, and they grow back over time, the craters are on top of the new ore/gems.

data.title: Added a levelup command
data.body: Was useful for testing veterancy. Not sure if it is worthwhile keeping though.

data.title: Fixed invulnerable infantry
data.body: Closes #6263

data.title: Cursor Doubling
data.body: Cursor now doubles with pixel doubling, enabled by a new checkbox in the settings menu.

data.title: Warhead cleanups
data.body:
This removes the remaining redundancy and floating point calculations from the warhead damage calculations.

The following are left for a future PR:
- Remove the redundant legacy "0% = no targeting" assumption.
- Remove the PerCellDamageWarhead type (which is bogus, and only used by the crate nuke weapons that we forgot to update when fixing the real nukes).

data.title: Invulnerable Veteran Rifleman
data.body:
This guy can't be damaged.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/3942201/35717c22-255a-11e4-9331-bc095b3e07a2.png)

Found it while testing https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6218 (after hitting the merge button...) Moving him does not resolve this. He is ranked up so this is probably related to IDamageModifier and GainsStatUpgrades.

data.title: Fixed silo fullness animations loop during building placement
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6084. Fixes #6258.

data.title: Attribute modifiers (Production time & Income)
data.body:
Meant to close #6103.

This functional (but sickly) PR allows you to select production time and income modifiers per player in the lobby.

But the chrome work I did for it is an **ugly abomination**, and I need input into what would be the best way to lay it out and display it.

It is, however, somewhat functional. Classic production queues work for all mods, and income modifiers work for all mods.

But C&C:TD style production queues do not currently seem to like fetching the production time modifier from the player actor. Busy looking into this.

I did do a "multiplayer" test between two clients on my machine and did not get any desyncs, so that at least is a good start.
Skirmish tests also worked fine.

data.title: Very slow menu screen and cursor
data.body:
Hello and good day.

I'm a first time user of OpenRA. 
So, I downloaded the latest released version for Windows.
Installation went good and I downloaded Red Alert.

However, after the download, coming to the game menu, everything slows down to a trickle. Horribly. Takes like 5 seconds to move the cursor as the menu screen lags horribly.

I'm not familiar with the technical aspects of the game. Just a normal gamer.
I hope someone can help me.

Thank you.

data.title: Will fix chinooks not taking sub cells into account later
data.body: Was to fix #6068 & #4605, but that will be handled later.
